bug.author: MbProg
bug.summary: wandb: ERROR To use wandb on Windows, you need to run the command "wandb run python <your_train_script>.py"
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.10 Python version: 3.6.4 Operating System: Windows 8
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I want first at all run the sample file: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/tutorial/blob/master/tutorial.py>https://github.com/wandb/tutorial/blob/master/tutorial.py</denchmark-link> , but it fails when running code line: wandb.init(project="sample-project") <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
I installed the packages for wandb. And then I run the code file mentioned above on my Windows 8 machine. <denchmark-code>Paste the command(s) you ran and the output. If there was a crash, please include the traceback here. </denchmark-code>
I just ran the file tutorial.py with python: python tutorial.py But I am getting the following error message: wandb: ERROR To use wandb on Windows, you need to run the command "wandb run python <your_train_script>.py"

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.55. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
What happens when you run: wandb run python tutorial.py That is the only supported way to use wandb with windows.

What happens when you run: wandb run python tutorial.py That is the only supported way to use wandb with windows.
I get the following error message: <denchmark-code>wandb: Program failed with code 2. Press ctrl-c to abort syncing. wandb: Process crashed early, not syncing files Traceback (most recent call last): File "c:\...anaconda3\lib\site-packages\wandb\compat\weakref.py", line 140, in _exitfunc f() File "c:\...\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\wandb\compat\weakref.py", line 64, in __call__ return info.func(*info.args, **(info.kwargs or {})) File "c:\...\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\wandb\compat\tempfile.py", line 57, in _cleanup _rmtree(name) File "c:\...\anaconda3\lib\shutil.py", line 494, in rmtree return _rmtree_unsafe(path, onerror) File "c:\...\anaconda3\lib\shutil.py", line 389, in _rmtree_unsafe onerror(os.unlink, fullname, sys.exc_info()) File "c:\...\anaconda3\lib\shutil.py", line 387, in _rmtree_unsafe os.unlink(fullname) PermissionError: [WinError 32] The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process: 'C:\\...\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\tmpyf3qve3iwandb\\wandb-metadata.json' </denchmark-code>
But why cannot run wandb in Windows?
Does that mean we cannot use it along with Jupyter notebooks in Windows?

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/TKassis>@TKassis</denchmark-link> it should work fine in jupyter. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MbProg>@MbProg</denchmark-link> we're going to push a new version of the cli this week that removes the requirement for on windows and fixes the error above. If you would like to try it now you can install with

Can't install this branch for some reason: (tf) D:\>pip install --upgrade git+git://github.com/wandb/client.git@feature/windows_no_run#egg=wandb Collecting wandb from git+git://github.com/wandb/client.git@feature/windows_no_run#egg=wandb Cloning git://github.com/wandb/client.git (to revision feature/windows_no_run) to c:\users\timothy\appdata\local\temp\pip-install-sbpybyu1\wandb Running command git clone -q git://github.com/wandb/client.git 'C:\Users\Timothy\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-install-sbpybyu1\wandb' WARNING: Did not find branch or tag 'feature/windows_no_run', assuming revision or ref. Running command git checkout -q feature/windows_no_run error: pathspec 'feature/windows_no_run' did not match any file(s) known to git ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: git checkout -q feature/windows_no_run Check the logs for full command output. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9168908/66779347-e45aac80-ee9b-11e9-9a66-5a0e347fb00f.jpg></denchmark-link>

I have an identical error.
They released version 0.8.13 already, but the sweep functionality still doesn't work with Windows.
Yeah, we‚Äôre working on the sweep functionality. 0.8.13 does remove the need for wandb run which is a big improvement. I‚Äôll update the thread once we have an update.

I just solved the issue this way: <denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/library/advanced/environment-variables>https://docs.wandb.com/library/advanced/environment-variables</denchmark-link> . Maybe it will help you. Although this is a bit strange.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/WaGGstoun>@WaGGstoun</denchmark-link> , which issue did you solve? what environment did you set?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/raubitsj>@raubitsj</denchmark-link> , I simple added an environment variable to my code, and thus, synchronization starts automatically, and not through . Since an error occurs when starting through . <denchmark-h:h3>Terminal output { when starting through wandb run python}</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "c:\users\user\anaconda3\envs\main\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", mod_spec) File "c:\users\user\anaconda3\envs\main\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "C:\Users\User\Anaconda3\envs\Main\Scripts\wandb.exe\__main__.py", line 4, in <module> File "c:\users\user\anaconda3\envs\main\lib\site-packages\wandb\cli.py", line 691, in <module> @display_error File "c:\users\user\anaconda3\envs\main\lib\site-packages\click\decorators.py", line 170, in decorator _param_memo(f, OptionClass(param_decls, **attrs)) File "c:\users\user\anaconda3\envs\main\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 1460, in __init__ Parameter.__init__(self, param_decls, type=type, **attrs) TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'hidden' </denchmark-code>

Sweeps are functional in windows with the latest versions of the wandb client. Windows users no longer need to use wandb run to start the training script. Closing this issue. Please reopen it if there is still an issue.
